items.title: Former CNN anchor Don Lemon arrested on charges related to Minnesota protest
items.description: The arrest comes after Don Lemon live-streamed a demonstration that interrupted a church service in St Paul, Minnesota, earlier this month that protested President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown in the area.

items.title: Trump nominates Kevin Warsh as new Fed chair
items.description: Mr Warsh will replace current chair Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

items.title: Gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante charged with family violence
items.description: Australian online gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante has appeared in a Perth court, accused of a slew of family violence, drugs and burglary offences.

items.title: Precious metal market crashes
items.description: Gold and silver prices have plummeted, sparked by reports US President Donald Trump is set to announce a new US Federal Reserve chair.

items.title: UBS lifts gold forecast to $6,200 as prices hit record highs

featured_image.name: Gold has more room to run as geopolitics, cenbank buying ... - Reuters

items.description:
UBS has increased its gold price target to $6,200 per ounce for March, June, and September 2026, up from its previous forecast of $5,000, citing stronger-than-expected demand stemming from increased investment flows and central bank buying.[1][2][3]

The upgrade came as spot gold surged to an all-time high of $5,594.82 on Thursday, extending a remarkable rally that has seen the precious metal climb more than 27% since the beginning of the year. The safe-haven metal has now achieved record highs for nine consecutive sessions.[4][5]

items.title: NASA begins critical Artemis II fueling test ahead of moon launch

featured_image.name: NASA moves critical fueling test for Artemis 2 moon rocket ...

items.description:
Two days after families gathered at Kennedy Space Center to mark the 40th anniversary of the Challenger disaster, NASA is pressing forward with final preparations for Artemis II, which will send astronauts around the Moon for the first time since 1972.

The space agency began wet dress rehearsal operations on Thursday evening at Launch Pad 39B, a critical fueling test that will determine whether the mission can proceed toward its targeted launch date of February 6. The test involves loading more than 700,000 gallons of cryogenic propellants into the Space Launch System rocket and running a simulated countdown.[1][2][3][4]

items.title: Andrew Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley
items.description: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the Liberal party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley this week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

items.title: Harvard scientist proposes global network to detect interstellar objects

featured_image.name: Avi Loeb calls out bias against research on interstellar ...

items.description:
The interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, which has been traversing our solar system since its discovery in July 2025, continues to reveal unusual features that have prompted scientists to propose a global early warning network for detecting future visitors from beyond our cosmic neighborhood.

A new scientific proposal led by Harvard astrophysicist Avi Loeb and co-authored with graduate researcher Oem Trivedi outlines what they describe as the Comprehensive Interstellar Objects Network, or CISON. The framework argues that humanity is currently underprepared to detect and respond to fast-moving objects arriving from interstellar space.[1]

items.title: NASA simulations reveal magnetic chaos before neutron stars collide

featured_image.name: NASA SVS | NASA Supercomputer Probes Tangled Magnetospheres ...

items.description:
NASA researchers have unveiled supercomputer simulations that provide an unprecedented view into the chaotic magnetic interactions between neutron stars in the final moments before they collide, identifying potential electromagnetic signals that future observatories could detect.

The new findings, announced by NASA on January 29, offer scientists their most detailed look yet at how the magnetospheres—highly magnetized, plasma-filled regions surrounding neutron stars—behave as the city-sized stellar remnants spiral toward a cataclysmic merger. The research, led by Dimitrios Skiathas, a graduate student at the University of Patras in Greece conducting work at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center, was published in The Astrophysical Journal.[1][2][3]

items.title: Trump says he plans to talk to Iran amid naval buildup

featured_image.name: Trump says he is planning to talk to Iran

items.description:
President Donald Trump confirmed on Thursday that he is planning to hold direct talks with Iran as tensions between Washington and Tehran escalate, pairing diplomatic signals with warnings about the naval forces now positioned near the Islamic Republic.

"I have had and I am planning on it," Trump told reporters at the Kennedy Center when asked about potential discussions with Iran. He simultaneously emphasized the military pressure, stating, "We have a lot of very big, very powerful ships sailing to Iran right now, and it would be great if we didn't have to use them".[1][2][3][4]

Speaking to CBS News on Thursday, Trump revealed he has communicated two key demands to Iran in recent conversations: "No. 1, no nuclear. And No. 2, stop killing protesters".[4]

items.title: The NDIS was set up to relieve families. For some, it now does the opposite
items.description: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that is set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

items.title: 'Devastating tragedy': Perth family dead in suspected murder-suicide
items.description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

items.title: Last-ditch deal sees government give states extra $25b in hospital funding
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bowed to mounting pressure from the states, promising an extra $25 billion for public hospitals.

items.title: Venezuela approves law ending 20 years of state oil control

featured_image.name: World Leaders Address United Nations General Assembly

items.description:
Venezuela's National Assembly on Thursday approved a sweeping reform to the country's hydrocarbons law, ending more than two decades of state control over the nation's oil sector and opening the door to private investment in the world's largest proven crude reserves.[1][2][3]

The vote marks a dramatic departure from the socialist economic model that has governed Venezuela since former President Hugo Chávez nationalized the industry in the mid-2000s. The legislation comes less than a month after the U.S. military captured then-President Nicolás Maduro in Caracas on January 3.[4][1]

items.title: More human remains, 'Celine Cremer's jacket' found in river search
items.description: More human remains and a jacket believed to belong to missing backpacker Celine Cremer have been found in a search of Tasmania's Arthur River, police say.

items.title: Djokovic turns back the clock to reach Aus Open final with marathon win over Sinner
items.description: Novak Djokovic will face Carlos Alcaraz in the Australian Open men's singles final after winning another epic semifinal against Jannik Sinner.

items.title: Gold surges to record high near $5,600 for ninth straight session

featured_image.name: Gold Just Hit a Record $5,600, What's Driving the Surge?

items.description: World stocks gained on Thursday as investors maintained their appetite for equities ahead of Apple results, while gold climbed to a record high for the ninth consecutive session. The rally in precious metals, coupled with strong corporate guidance from Meta, provided support across global markets despite concerns over tech sector capital expenditure.

items.title: Amazon in talks to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI

featured_image.name: Amazon could invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI in coming weeks, source says

items.description:
Amazon.com, Inc. is negotiating a potential investment of up to $50 billion in OpenAI, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal on Thursday, a deal that would represent one of the largest bets yet on artificial intelligence and deepen ties between the world's largest cloud-computing provider and the maker of ChatGPT.

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy is personally leading the discussions with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, sources familiar with the matter told The Wall Street Journal and CNBC. The final structure of any potential deal remains fluid, though a term sheet could be finalized in the coming weeks, according to CNBC.[1][2][3]

items.title: Apple posts record quarter as iPhone sales surge 23%

featured_image.name: Apple Revenue Pops 16% to Nearly $144 Billion in Year-End 2025 ...

items.description:
Apple delivered what CEO Tim Cook called a "remarkable, record-breaking quarter" on Thursday, posting fiscal first-quarter results that far exceeded Wall Street expectations as iPhone sales surged 23% year-over-year to drive the company's best holiday period ever.

The tech giant reported revenue of $143.8 billion for the quarter ending December 27, up 16% from the prior year and well ahead of analyst estimates of $138.4 billion. Earnings per share reached $2.84, a 19% increase that set a new all-time record and topped the $2.67 consensus forecast.[1][2][3]

items.title: Nvidia, Microsoft and Amazon in talks to invest $60B in OpenAI

featured_image.name: OpenAI seek investments from Middle East for multibillion-dollar round

items.description:
Nvidia, Microsoft and Amazon are in discussions to invest up to $60 billion in OpenAI, according to a report by The Information published Wednesday. The talks, if they lead to a deal, would be one of the largest private financings ever for an AI company and would further entangle the world’s biggest technology suppliers in the scramble for computing power and market share in generative AI.[1][2][3]

The negotiations are ongoing and terms could change, and Reuters said it could not immediately verify The Information’s reporting. Still, the report fits a widening fundraising push around OpenAI that has drawn in major strategic backers and deep pools of global capital.[3][1]

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.title: Elon Musk's Humanoid Robot Vision: China Poised to Lead Production
items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
